intro: Graffenrieda moaensis, commonly known as the Moa Mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
